content:
In the previous chapter we have learned that moving charges or electric currents produce magnetic fields. This discovery, which was made in the early part of the nineteenth century is credited to Oersted, Ampere, Biot and Savart, among others.

In the present chapter, we take a look at magnetism as a subject in its own right.

Some of the commonly known ideas regarding magnetism are:
summary: This chapter describes the discovery and early history of magnetism and its importance to alternating current theory. We will also learn about simple magnetic systems such as the magnetic dipole and that moving charges produce a magnetic field.
hypothetical_questions: What one known idea regarding magnetism? What one unknown idea?
How is magnetism commonly used in technology?
